metadata: For example, telling people your salary.
questionString: I am private when it comes to disclosing my earnings

metadata: For example, setting up bill payments over the phone rather than using the internet.
questionString: I do not use the internet to manage my finances.
I avoid using online banking, either through the internet or mobile applications.
I try to use intermediary purchase software, such as PayPal, when paying online

metadata: For example, when your password is updated.
questionString: Businesses should only email me when I update something to do with my account

metadata: Often Email addresses can be sold to third party companies, of which a user may not have directly signed up to.
questionString: Businesses I have not given my email address to shouldn’t be able to contact me by email.
I am protective with who I give my telephone number to
Businesses should not be able to contact me by telephone
I am protective with who I give my address to
I am protective when it comes to disclosing work details
I am concerned of any data linking me to other people I may know

metadata: Preferences, such as search results, are often used to give target advertising and other services.
questionString: Businesses shouldn’t know any preferences about me unless I give consent.

metadata: Using sites such as EasyJet to book holidays
questionString: I use the internet to book holidays/trips

metadata: Using software such as Google Maps in order to navigate
questionString: I often use location services to help with navigation

metadata: Software which tracks steps/distance walked etc.
questionString: I use fitness applications which track my location

metadata: For example, checking if a train/plane is on time.
questionString: I often use the internet to check travel plans

metadata: For example, checking in on facebook.
questionString: I do not post my location when using social media applications
No records about my person should be shown to Junior Doctors/Nurses to aid with training.

metadata: For example, a doctor getting a second opinion from a specialist
questionString: Most Medical Institutions will share my medical records if it benefits me.
I have/had a medical condition/problem that I am embarrassed about

metadata: Some records can contain personal information (such as a name) which could identify an individual
questionString: My medical records should only be used in medical research if the records are made anonymous
I would be concerned if my medical records were used within research and testing.
Too many medical staff have access my patient records, even though they don’t need access.
Information about me should be used in a court of law if it is deemed necessary
I often use Incognito/Private browsing or other steps to help ensure my privacy when online
The current Privacy laws provide a reasonable level of protection for resident’s privacy.

metadata: For example, not using a website because it may be fraudulent
questionString: I often go out of my way to make sure my communications on the internet are not monitored.

metadata: For example, departments such as GCHQ and NSA collecting data on citizens
questionString: The Government collects too much private data from individuals.
The information I disclose in conversations on the internet is often very private/classified, and would cause myself and others issues if it was disclosed

metadata: Also includes other software such as TOR.
questionString: I use VPN’s and other routing software to make sure my communications cannot be traced back to me
